data.title: Scoresheet
data.statement:
Keep track of the scores, and output the player with the most points, along with how many points they got. In the case of a tie, output both players.

Each command [[C]] will tell you to either adjust the score of the player ({{A}}) or adjust the multiplier ({{M}}). Every player's score should start at {{0}}, and each player's multiplier at {{5}}.

When adjusting the score of the player, add {{S}} times that player's multiplier to that player's score. When adjusting a multiplier, add {{S}} to the player’s current multiplier.

Example Input:
3
P1 M 2
P1 A 5
P2 A 7
Example Output:
P1 P2
35

testCases.title: Adjusting Scores
testCases.testIn:
5
PlayerA A 5
PlayerB A 3
PlayerC A 6
PlayerA A 2
PlayerB A 7

testCases.title: Adjusting Scores Validator
testCases.testIn:
5
APlayer A 3
BPlayer A 2
CPlayer A 4
APlayer A 6
BPlayer A 5

testCases.title: Adjusting Both
testCases.testIn:
6
AAA M 2
ABA A 8
ABA M 1
ABA A 6
AAA A 5
AAA A 7

testCases.title: Adjusting Both Validator
testCases.testIn:
6
BAA M 3
BBA A 7
BBA M 2
BBA A 5
BAA A 4
BAA A 6

testCases.title: Negative Numbers
testCases.testIn:
4
Yay M -10
Yay A 5
Nay M 10
Nay A -6

testCases.title: Negative Numbers Validator
testCases.testIn:
4
Yea M -9
Yea A 7
Nea M 8
Nea A -8

testCases.title: Tie
testCases.testIn:
3
J A 1
K A 1
L A 1

testCases.title: Tie Validator
testCases.testIn:
3
M A 2
N A 2
O A 1

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read c:string(11)
write answer

INPUT
c: Command (<player> <mode: A|M> <amount>)
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of commands.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> A string for the name of the player being adjusted, a string for the mode of the command, and an integer the amount to adjust by, all space-separated.
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> The names of the player(s) that won. If a tie, separate them with spaces, and put them in order that you received them.
<<Line 2:>> How many points the player(s) got.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Keep track of the scores, and output the player with the most points, along with how many points they got. In the case of a tie, output both players.

Each command C will tell you to either adjust the score of the player (A) or adjust the multiplier (M). Every player's score should start at 0, and each player's multiplier at 5.

When adjusting the score of the player, add S times that player's multiplier to that player's score. When adjusting a multiplier, add S to the player’s current multiplier.

Example Input:
3
P1 M 2
P1 A 5
P2 A 7
Example Output:
P1 P2
35
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of commands.
Next N lines: A string for the name of the player being adjusted, a string for the mode of the command, and an integer the amount to adjust by, all space-separated.
Output
Line 1: The names of the player(s) that won. If a tie, separate them with spaces, and put them in order that you received them.
Line 2: How many points the player(s) got.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 6
-10 ≤ A ≤ 10
-100 ≤ Final score ≤ 100
Example
Input
5
PlayerA A 5
PlayerB A 3
PlayerC A 6
PlayerA A 2
PlayerB A 7
Output
PlayerB
50
